refnamediv.refpurpose: bind a framebuffer to a framebuffer target

listitem.para: Specifies the framebuffer target of the binding operation.
Specifies the name of the framebuffer object to bind.

refsection.para: glBindFramebuffer binds the framebuffer object with name framebuffer to the framebuffer target specified by target. target must be either GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER. If a framebuffer object is bound to GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER, it becomes the target for rendering or readback operations, respectively, until it is deleted or another framebuffer is bound to the corresponding bind point. Calling glBindFramebuffer with target set to GL_FRAMEBUFFER binds framebuffer to both the read and draw framebuffer targets. framebuffer is the name of a framebuffer object previously returned from a call to glGenFramebuffers, or zero to break the existing binding of a framebuffer object to target.
GL_INVALID_ENUM is generated if target is not GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER or GL_FRAMEBUFFER.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION is generated if framebuffer is not zero or the name of a framebuffer previously returned from a call to glGenFramebuffers.
